alert.note: Alert for Coffey (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 30 at 9:15PM CDT until July 31 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR WESTERN COFFEY AND SOUTHEASTERN LYON COUNTIES... At 913 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near John Redmond Reservoir, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 908 PM CDT, a spotter in Lebo reported golfball sized hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Lebo, New Strawn, Hartford, Neosho Rapids, John Redmond Reservoir and Le Roy. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 141 and 146, and between mile markers 150 and 154. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
